ID.name: ID
ID.desc: Semi-colon separated list of unique identifiers where available

REF.name: REF
REF.desc: The value in the POS field refers to the position of the first base in the String

ALT.name: ALT
ALT.desc: Comma separated list of alternate non-reference alleles called on at least one of the samples

INFO_GENEINFO.name: INFO_GENEINFO
INFO_GENEINFO.desc: Pairs each of gene symbol:gene id.  The gene symbol and id are delimited by a colon (:) and each pair is delimited by a vertical bar (|)

INFO_SAO.name: INFO_SAO
INFO_SAO.desc: Variant Allele Origin: 0 - unspecified, 1 - Germline, 2 - Somatic, 3 - Both

INFO_SSR.name: INFO_SSR
INFO_SSR.desc: Variant Suspect Reason Codes (may be more than one value added together) 0 - unspecified, 1 - Paralog, 2 - byEST, 4 - oldAlign, 8 - Para_EST, 16 - 1kg_failed, 1024 - other

INFO_WGT.name: INFO_WGT
INFO_WGT.desc: Weight, 00 - unmapped, 1 - weight 1, 2 - weight 2, 3 - weight 3 or more

INFO_TPA.name: INFO_TPA
INFO_TPA.desc: Provisional Third Party Annotation(TPA) (currently rs from PHARMGKB who will give phenotype data)

INFO_PMC.name: INFO_PMC
INFO_PMC.desc: Links exist to PubMed Central article

INFO_NSF.name: INFO_NSF
INFO_NSF.desc: Has non-synonymous frameshift A coding region variation where one allele in the set changes all downstream amino acids. FxnClass = 44

INFO_NSM.name: INFO_NSM
INFO_NSM.desc: Has non-synonymous missense A coding region variation where one allele in the set changes protein peptide. FxnClass = 42

INFO_NSN.name: INFO_NSN
INFO_NSN.desc: Has non-synonymous nonsense A coding region variation where one allele in the set changes to STOP codon (TER). FxnClass = 41

INFO_REF.name: INFO_REF
INFO_REF.desc: Has reference A coding region variation where one allele in the set is identical to the reference sequence. FxnCode = 8

INFO_SYN.name: INFO_SYN
INFO_SYN.desc: Has synonymous A coding region variation where one allele in the set does not change the encoded amino acid. FxnCode = 3

INFO_U3.name: INFO_U3
INFO_U3.desc: In 3' UTR Location is in an untranslated region (UTR). FxnCode = 53

INFO_U5.name: INFO_U5
INFO_U5.desc: In 5' UTR Location is in an untranslated region (UTR). FxnCode = 55

INFO_OTH.name: INFO_OTH
INFO_OTH.desc: Has other variant with exactly the same set of mapped positions on NCBI refernce assembly.

INFO_CFL.name: INFO_CFL
INFO_CFL.desc: Has Assembly conflict. This is for weight 1 and 2 variant that maps to different chromosomes on different assemblies.

INFO_ASP.name: INFO_ASP
INFO_ASP.desc: Is Assembly specific. This is set if the variant only maps to one assembly

INFO_MUT.name: INFO_MUT
INFO_MUT.desc: Is mutation (journal citation, explicit fact): a low frequency variation that is cited in journal and other reputable sources

INFO_VLD.name: INFO_VLD
INFO_VLD.desc: Is Validated.  This bit is set if the variant has 2+ minor allele count based on frequency or genotype data.

INFO_G5A.name: INFO_G5A
INFO_G5A.desc: >5% minor allele frequency in each and all populations

INFO_HD.name: INFO_HD
INFO_HD.desc: Marker is on high density genotyping kit (50K density or greater).  The variant may have phenotype associations present in dbGaP.

INFO_GNO.name: INFO_GNO
INFO_GNO.desc: Genotypes available. The variant has individual genotype (in SubInd table).

INFO_CDA.name: INFO_CDA
INFO_CDA.desc: Variation is interrogated in a clinical diagnostic assay

INFO_NOC.name: INFO_NOC
INFO_NOC.desc: Contig allele not present in variant allele list. The reference sequence allele at the mapped position is not present in the variant allele list, adjusted for orientation.

INFO_WTD.name: INFO_WTD
INFO_WTD.desc: Is Withdrawn by submitter If one member ss is withdrawn by submitter, then this bit is set.  If all member ss' are withdrawn, then the rs is deleted to SNPHistory

INFO_NOV.name: INFO_NOV
INFO_NOV.desc: Rs cluster has non-overlapping allele sets. True when rs set has more than 2 alleles from different submissions and these sets share no alleles in common.

INFO_CAF.name: INFO_CAF
INFO_CAF.desc: An ordered, comma delimited list of allele frequencies based on 1000Genomes, starting with the reference allele followed by alternate alleles as ordered in the ALT column. Where a 1000Genomes alternate allele is not in the dbSNPs alternate allele set, the allele is added to the ALT column.  The minor allele is the second largest value in the list, and was previuosly reported in VCF as the GMAF.  This is the GMAF reported on the RefSNP and EntrezSNP pages and VariationReporter

INFO_COMMON.name: INFO_COMMON
INFO_COMMON.desc: RS is a common SNP.  A common SNP is one that has at least one 1000Genomes population with a minor allele of frequency >= 1% and for which 2 or more founders contribute to that minor allele frequency.
